cab.content: SECRET.Priority,OPERATIONS,From!" General Plumer, Italy.C.I.G.SWar Office.Despatched 8.50 p,m, 18,11,17.Re ceived3a,m, 19,11,17,0.19,You have had the situailon from RadcliffFoch andI this morning offered to take over as soon as possible after (?) Nov. 24th each a sector of the northern portion of the front in the Asiago neighbourhood relieving same number of Italian divisions as v,re had available, provided that the Italian divisions remaining in the, sectors are placed under orders of French and British commanders respectively, Diaz received this favourably and vo.ll give definite answer Nov,20th, I have seen to-day commanders of 1st and 4th Armies and on both their fronts their troops are holding their own well and have not been seriously pressed, The general situation seems certainly more f s^vourable ,
